result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:

and notice of DNA and witness list
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

01:55 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni for Erin Nagy.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

02:17 PM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Phillip R Kroning appeared by video means.  Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Phillip R Kroning
Current: 4670 Hayes Rd Apt 3, Madison, WI 53704   (Effective: 05-16-2022)
Prior: 6900 Seybold Rd Apt 111, Madison, WI 53719
Def's NOH and unsigned bond form returned - Attempted - not known/unable to forward
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with EK, HK, KK, or PK except only as allowed by Juvenile Court Order. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:02 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
